Thank you to @DefenderOrg, @ACLU_WA, @CityAttyPeteH, @SeattlePD, @KCProsecutor, @KingCoSheriff, advocates and others for creating this program and sparking this movement.

Helping people instead of funneling them into a cycle of jail and re-arrests simply makes sense. Funding current LEAD programs and helping new states begin the program is a no-brainer. I hope that House Appropriators will strongly consider LEAD funding as they plan for FY19.

Seattle charted a path for the LEAD program, and now it has been implemented in 31 states across the nation.

We cannot arrest our way out of crises like the opioid epidemic ‚Äì we need innovative, evidence-based treatment solutions like LEAD to truly change our society.

LEAD is a pre-booking diversion program that allows law enforcement to connect low-level offenders to treatment, instead of unnecessarily putting them in the criminal justice system. LEAD pairs program participants with casework services and treatment resources.

My colleagues and I are asking the House to fund creation of a Law Enforcement Assisted Diversion (LEAD) grant program to help combat the opioid epidemic and safeguard against rampant over-incarceration.

I'm proud to support this powerful, Seattle-created program. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DYf9goyUMAAV8lr.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DYf-PQ8U0AAiTfY.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DYf-P6gVoAA94jC.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DYf-QUQVoAAv4Yc.jpg
